passages.text: August 28, 2025 06:31 AM GMT
Attention to each policy board member's stance may grow ahead Generally cautious tone regarding examining outlook ahead Limited update on the Boj's internal views about the US economic outlook

Attention to each policy board member's stance may grow ahead: Boj Board Member Junko Nakagawa delivered a speech at the meeting in Yamaguchi. At the July Monetary Policy Meeting (MPM), the number of board members who viewed downside risks to both the economy and prices had decreased. However, Gov. Ueda reemphasized his cautious stance during the post- MPM press conference. Thus attention to each member's individual policy stance is likely to grow ahead. In the near term, a speech by Dep. Gov. Himino is scheduled for September 2.

Generally cautious tone regarding examining outlook ahead: Nakagawa conveyed a generally cautious tone regarding examining the economic outlook. For example, she first pointed out a risk that "if firms, in response to tariff policies, have to focus much more on cost cutting over passing on cost increases to selling prices, moves to reflect price rises in wages could weaken." That said, there were also comments potentially indicating policy implications on underlying inflation trends, e.g., using the distribution of item- level CPI price changes, and Nakagawa noted that "The tails of the distribution have been extended upward, and the simple median has been at around 2 percent." She also emphasized the importance of the Sep Boj Tankan.

Limited update on the Boj's internal views about the US economic outlook: At the July MPM, Gov. Ueda stated, "we want to observe how tariff policies affect hard data such as exports, production, and employment in the US," and "we believe the global economy, including Japan, is heading toward a slowdown, and we want to assess the extent of that deceleration given the high uncertainty." However, in today's Nakagawa's speech, updates to the Boj's views on the global economic outlook were relatively limited. Going forward, attention would be paid to upcoming Boj communications, including speeches by board members, e.g., for examining the Boj's internal views on the US economic outlook.
MORGAN STANLEY MUFG SECURITIES CO., LTD.
Masayuki Inui (morganstanleymufg.com
Chief Japan Economist
Takeshi Yamaguchi (morganstanleymufg.com
Exhibit 1: Policy Board Members' Forecasts and Risk Assessments

Note: 1. The solid lines show actual figures, while the dotted lines show the medians of the Policy Board member forecasts (point estimates). 2. The locations of \(\widehat{\mathbb{Q}}\) and \(\mathbb{W}\) in the charts indicate the figures for each Policy Board member's forecasts to which they attach the highest probability. The risk balances assessed by each Policy Board member is shown by the following shapes: \(\widehat{\mathbb{Q}}\) indicates that a member assesses "positive and desirable risks as being generally balanced"; \(\widehat{\mathbb{Q}}\) indicates that a member assesses "risks are skewed to the upside"; and \(\mathbb{W}\) indicates that a member assesses "risks are skewed to the downside."
Source: BoJ (July Outlook Report)
Exhibit 2: Distribution of Actual Price Changes
Distribution of Actual Price Changes
Note: Figures are based on the year-on-year price changes for each CPI item.
Source: BoJ (Board member Nakagawa's presentation)
